verses.kjv: In the year that king Uzziah died I saw also the LORD sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.
verses.web: In the year that king Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up; and his train filled the temple.
verses.ct: In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the LORD seated on a throne, high and exalted, and the flowing hem of his robe filled the entire temple.

verses.kjv: Above it stood the seraphims: each one had six wings; with twain he covered his face, and with twain he covered his feet, and with twain he did fly.
verses.web: Above him stood the seraphim. Each one had six wings. With two he covered his face. With two he covered his feet. With two he flew.
verses.ct: Seraphim hovered above him, each with 6 wings — 2 covering their faces, 2 covering their feet, and 2 for flying.

verses.kjv: And one cried unto another, and said, Holy, holy, holy, is the LORD of hosts: the whole earth is full of his glory.
verses.web: One called to another, and said, “Holy, holy, holy, is LORD of Armies! The whole earth is full of his glory!”
verses.ct: They called out to one another, "Holy, holy, holy is the LORD of hosts! The whole earth is full of his glory!"

verses.kjv: And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried, and the house was filled with smoke.
verses.web: The foundations of the thresholds shook at the voice of him who called, and the house was filled with smoke.
verses.ct: The doorposts shook at the sound of their voices, and the temple filled with smoke.

verses.kjv: Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: Then I said, “Woe is me! For I am undone, because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell among a people of unclean lips: for my eyes have seen the King, LORD of Armies!”
verses.ct: I cried out, "I'm ruined! I'm a man with unclean lips, living among a people with unclean lips — and my own eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts!"

verses.kjv: Then flew one of the seraphims unto me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar:
verses.web: Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar.
verses.ct: Then one of the seraphim flew to me carrying a burning coal he had picked up from the altar with a pair of tongs.

verses.kjv: And he laid it upon my mouth, and said, Lo, this hath touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin purged.
verses.web: He touched my mouth with it, and said, “Behold, this has touched your lips; and your iniquity is taken away, and your sin forgiven.”
verses.ct: He pressed it against my mouth and said, "This has touched your lips. Your guilt is removed, and your sin is forgiven."

verses.kjv: Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying, Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then said I, Here am I; send me.
verses.web: I heard the Lord’s voice, saying, “Whom shall I send, and who will go for us?” Then I said, “Here I am. Send me!”
verses.ct: Then I heard the voice of the Lord saying, "Whom shall I send? Who will go for us?" I answered, "Here I am. Send me!"

verses.kjv: And he said, Go, and tell this people, Hear ye indeed, but understand not; and see ye indeed, but perceive not.
verses.web: He said, “Go, and tell this people, ‘You hear indeed, but don’t understand. You see indeed, but don’t perceive.’
verses.ct: He said, "Go and tell this people: 'You will listen and listen but never understand. You will look and look but never grasp what you see.'

verses.kjv: Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and convert, and be healed.
verses.web: Make the heart of this people fat. Make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and turn again, and be healed.”
verses.ct: "Make the hearts of this people dull, their ears deaf, and their eyes blind — so they won't see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts, and turn back and be healed."

verses.kjv: Then said I, Lord, how long? And he answered, Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate,
verses.web: Then I said, “Lord, how long?” He answered, “Until cities are waste without inhabitant, houses without man, the land becomes utterly waste,
verses.ct: I asked, "Lord, how long will this go on?" He answered, "Until the cities lie in ruins with no one living in them, until the houses are empty, and the land is completely devastated —

verses.kjv: And the LORD have removed men far away, and there be a great forsaking in the midst of the land.
verses.web: and LORD has removed men far away, and the forsaken places are many within the land.
verses.ct: "until the LORD has driven everyone far away, and the land is utterly abandoned."

verses.kjv: But yet in it shall be a tenth, and it shall return, and shall be eaten: as a teil tree, and as an oak, whose substance is in them, when they cast their leaves: so the holy seed shall be the substance thereof.
verses.web: If there is a tenth left in it, that also will in turn be consumed, as a terebinth, and as an oak, whose stump remains when they are cut down; so the holy seed is its stock.”
verses.ct: "Even if a 10th of the people remain, they too will be consumed again — like a terebinth or an oak that is cut down but leaves a stump behind. That stump is the holy seed."
